Crude Divorce Rate (Per 1,000 Residents):
From 2004 onwards, data are based on divorces and annulments where either or both spouses are residents (i.e Singapore citizens or permanent residents).
Definitions
Crude Divorce Rate:
Crude divorce rate refers to the number of divorces and annulments granted in the year per thousand population.
General Divorce Rate:
General divorce rate refers to the number of divorces and annulments granted to married persons aged 20 years and over during the year, out of every thousand married persons in the same age group.
Notation:
na   not available or not applicable
nec  not elsewhere classified
nes  not elsewhere specified
-     nil or negligible or not significant
Notes
Numbers may not add up to the totals due to rounding.
Data are the latest available at the time of access or download. Some statistics, particularly those for the most recent time periods, are provisional and may be subject to revision at a later date.
Values are shown in Singapore dollars (unless otherwise specified).
